item.description:
Thursday, July 14, 2011, 7:00 pm – 8:30 pm
Myles Standish State Forest, CCC Amphitheater (behind the Headquarters building)
In case of rain:  MSSF Headquarters Conference Building At the Forum, DCR staff will present, and solicit public comments on a draft Myles Standish State Forest (MSSF) Resource Management Plan. The DCR will accept written comments during a 60-day comment period following the Forum and post them on the DCR website. Upon review and discussion with any stakeholders with major concerns, the final draft will be circulated internally and then submitted to the DCR Stewardship Council for further review and comments.

Previous presentations, public comments and questions are available now on DCR’s website at  http://www.mass.gov/dcr/news/publicmeetings/rmppast.htm .  Many of you have attended previous presentations. Emails and letters received through 4/30/11 have been posted. Questions and concerns at the last presentation were posted. 
The May 25th public presentation was posted.   The recreational proposals included: --Fix the dam bridge near the headquarters. (Sorry, just couldn't resist.) --Reopen Fearing Pond for day usage. --Clean the bathrooms more on peak weekends. --Fix the bike path. --"Review the camp structure program to ensure maximum public access, safety and natural resource protection."  (?? ) -- Increase interpretive resources mid-June to August. (We've previously posted calendars with listings of the many hiking and learning activities in the park.) -- Put up more interpretive signs and map-holders with maps. (I suppose they'd have to fix the trail signs too.) (I did notice some new and improved signage on the east side bike trails recently.) -- Study whether or not a visitors center is feasible -- Work with partners (including FMSSF, I suppose) to control invasive species, build native plant gardens and pine barrens interpretive programs. It also noted the Friends of MSSF sponsor:
– Pine Barrens Community Initiative – Native plant greenhouse and garden – Trail enhancement projects – Annual fishing derby – Annual photo contest (Perhaps they should also note our encouragement of frequent focused navigation perambulatory opportunities within the park.) (Hikes) There are also sections on managing the natural and cultural resources of the forest. Evidently, the Fearing Pond bathhouse is the only CCC bathhouse remaining within the park system and its preservation is indicated. (I don't think that includes reopening-- just stopping the decay.) Draft  Natural  Resource  Recommendations include • Implement fire management program •  Continue the current ban on motorized off-highway vehicles • Remove non-native tree plantations • Maintain a variety of grasslands and early successional forests These are pretty uncontroversial but this May's First Sunday hike with Bill Vickstrom showed how resource management can have dramatic effects. I wonder what "non-native tree plantations" they have in mind. Hope to see you there.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: (DCR) Public Forum for the Myles Standish SF Resource Management Plan
